intro: Impatiens mindiae, commonly known as the Mindi impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and grows as an annual or perennial herb, depending on the climate. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
